featured.text: A standard of living is considered high when it includes __(31)__ necessities but also certain comforts and luxuries; it is considered low when food, clean water, housing, and __(32)__ necessities are limited or lacking.
They usually do not meet the standard of exercise recommended by WHO.
He later created a standard of measuring children’s intelligence 28 the data he had collected from the French children he studied.
Which of the following statements is NOT true? (A) Jack’s Disk Doctor Service has only one standard fee.

other.text: Generally, the biggest complaint among home exchangers has to do with different standards of cleanliness.
The U.S. has one of the world’s highest standards of living.
The position of the bindi is standard: center of the forehead, close to the eyebrows.
Different __(33)__ have been employed by economists to measure standard of living.
Americans __(38)__ different racial and educational backgrounds may vary in their standards of living.
Swiss generals decided to issue each soldier a standard knife to serve both as a screwdriver and a can opener.
Of course, in determining overall standards of living of Americans, factors __(40)__ household composition and family size need also to be taken into consideration.
The higher this percentage is, the __(35)__ is the standard of living of these people.
People living in different parts of the U.S. __(39)__ show different standards of living.

definition.en_def: A level of quality or attainment.
definition.example: The product meets the safety standards required by law.
